intro: Oldenlandia caffra, commonly known as the African spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or along stream banks. The flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
